A woman of grace, Mrs. James recovers brilliantly.

Her knees buckle, her l give way, she grabs the table for support. Her face horrified. . CLOSE ON THE LETTER. Hand-lettered, scribbled in stark bl ink are the words...

dialogues.text: ‘Do you know who delivered this? There's no postmark or return address.

dialogues.text: Nothing. - Julie moves past her, down the hall, trying hard to remai calm in her mother's presence. Mrs. James just-shakes her head in silent worry.

CLOSE ON her face. Her once classic looks now seem harsh and stark under her mask of heavy make-up. This is a different Helen. Except for the hair. It's as b and luscious as ever. Feet pounding, Barry charges for the boardwalk, trying desperately to outrun the car as it speeds towards him. H crosses over to the boardwalk, but the BMW doesn't flinch It torpedoes towards him. Barry comes to a dead end, Crab pots stacked in front of old billboard. He looks about, sizing up his options. The BMW hits the brakes, reverses and spins the car around sharply so that it faces Barry head on. Barry's trapped. The car IDLES, as if egging him on, daring him to make a for it. Barry tries to make out who's driving. But it's too dark, all he can see is a SHAPE. The car REVS. Barry, scared shitless, must make a decision. He makes a run for it, bu the car has him. It hits the gas, PLOWING into him, sendi him CRASEING through the the crab pots, into the billboard...through it..and onto the boardwalk beyond.

Barry, near tears, lifts himself up, looking towards the He tries to get up but fails, collapsing, falling face do onto the boardwalk. Suddenly, he hears the car door SQUEAK OPEN. dialogues.text: The wait is over.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: We have to help each other. Alright? We have to stay together. Pure silence. A moment. They accept this. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Okay. So if it's not fisherboy here, who's doing all this? How do we find him?

dialogues.speaker: . JULIE
dialogues.text: We think his name is Billy Blue. Ray reacts.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: How do you know that?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: David's sister said there was a friend named Billy Blue.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Who probably went to school with David Gregg. So according to little sis that would make him Class of ‘84.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Elsa was Class of ‘84.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (moving to the front door) ELSA! . 80 INT.’ ELSA'S BEDROOM - FEW MINUTES LATER 80 Elsa's room is the flip version of Helen's. Very practica They all surround Elsa, who's getting ready for work.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: I remember David. Complete fuck-up.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: Major lush. He was drunk when he got in that car accident. Drunk as shit~-ran off the road--the police didn't even give him a DUI. He killed his girlfriend and got away with it. Completely.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Did he have any close friends you can remember? A guy named Billy Blue maybe? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: ZT don't have time for this shit. Some of us have to work.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Please, Elsa! Something about the way her sister pleads. It sounds so desperate. Elsa caves.

dialogues.speaker: ELSA
dialogues.text: We didn't travel in the same circles. I got a yearbook. Maybe there's something in there. She pulls a yearbook from under her bed and ‘slings it at Helen. : .

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crowd on Helen's bed, flipping through the yearbook. They're all cooperating with each other. A first.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Look, David Gregg.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: . Where? CLOSE ON a row of sports photos. TIGHT ON A YOUNG TEEN, handsome and athletic, suited up in his football uniform. kneels, holding his helmet. (NOTE: A younger version of t man from the dock in the opening scene.)

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: David Gregg. They all go silent. Spellbound by his image. RAY . That's him, huh. Hard to believe that's the guy.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Yeah, his face isn't splattered all over the road. Julie turns the page.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: We're looking for Billy. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: col HELEN There's a lot of Billy's, just no Blue.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Maybe Blue's not his real name.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: That's right. He could have easily lied to Missy. We did.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go see Missy again. If she had this yearbook in front of her...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (catching on) ..she could point him out. - Ray backs off.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: I'm not going anywhere. High school Mugshots. This is insane.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to Helen) . MN I'll go. You've got the parade today.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Forget it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: No. You need to be there. He could show ud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him to show up. He's already been in my house. Whacked my hair. I've had about enough of him. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: This could be our chance. We could catch him. I'll go to Missy's. Barry, you go with Helen to the parade, don't let her out of your sight. If he shows up...

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I'll pound his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to yourselves. You sound like a Me bunch of vigilantes. . (CONTINUED)
Julie unleashes on Ray. Her determination near frantic. Silence. Finally. Ray moves Julie has

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It's July 4th, Ray. This is his day. Whatever he has planned is going to happen today unless we stop him.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: How? By killing him? They all stare at each other. The tension deadly.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: We have a right to protect ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: That's a murderer's rationale.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: No one's gonna murder anyone.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: What are you going to call it? Another accident?

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: We don't have time for this moral shit. Ray, are you going to help or are you going to be a little limp ass wuss? to Julie, grabbing her. Desperate. RAY . Come on, Julie. Don't you see? It's the same thing all over again. It's that moment where we have to make a decision. Let's make the right one this time.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I'm not interested in what's right anymore. I wanna do what's smart.

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Then let's get the hell out of here. We'll leave town. Disappear.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I've already disappeared. And now I want my life back. We have to face this. never been more determined. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What's it going to be, Ray? Ray lowers his head in answer. Julie turns and rushes out the door, before her emotions a chance to respond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite a drab and overcast day,- the Croaker Festival is full swing. Tourists and townspeople flock the boardwalk where all sorts of booths have been set up. Arts and craf bake sales, etc. Main street has been roped off and people have already started gathering, waiting for the parade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On a side street, the parade lines up. Hometown floats of giant fish and shrimp and other sea life are pulled by decorated cars and trucks. The local high school band WAR UP. Helen leans against a float of huge colorful seashells. She's barely recognizable. Her hair has been slicked back make-up applied, her tiara in place. She looks striking, sexy even. Barry stands next to her.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I'm going to ride up in the truck. Signal if you see anything.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: I've never seen him. How will I...

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: You'll know. Helen nods, very uptight...nervous. HELEN . Look at me, I look like shit. Everybody's gonna see my hair.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: We could lose the vanity. We have other concerns. .

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Why do you hate me so much? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Her eyes pierce his. This catches him off guard. Fora moment his wall comes down. His face turns soft...his eye gentle.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I don't hate you, Hellie. Barry touches her slick hair.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: You know, I kinda like you this way. You kinda got a European thing happening. She smiles at him. She finds his gentleness very soothing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie makes her way down e long country road. The yearboo lies in the seat next to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The skies are dark and overcast. But it doesn't keep away the crowds that line the street as the Croaker Festival parade is under way. The high school band marches in fron followed by float after float--all in some nautical theme Finally, Helen's float rides by. She sits in a seashell throne with her tiara and scepter. She waves to the crowd CLOSE ON her face...tight, nervous. Barry rides in the truck up front. He turns to her and smiles. This brings her a small measure of comfort. She looks out to the crowd, waving...her hand tiring, suddenl the... FISHERMAN APPEARS...standing behind a MOTHER and CHILD. T Fisherman wears the slicker's hood over his head, shieldi his face from being seen. Helen's heart starts POUNDING. She waves frantically at Barry whose head is turned away from her.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: The band...the crowds...the noise drowns her cries. The Fisherman doesn't flinch, he just stands...watching Silently. His body still. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Finally Barry turns around to see Helen motioning to him. She points to the crowd. Barry sees him instantly and boi from the truck...pushing his way through the crowd. Helen loses Barry in the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry pushes and shoves his way through. He sees the Fisherman walking away, towards the boardwalk. He moves o him, coming upon him, PLOWING into him. The Fisherman goe down...his hood comes off to reveal... AN OLD MAN, thin and fragile...definitely not a threat to anyone. .

dialogues.speaker: OLD MAN
dialogues.text: Please! Please! Barry backs off immediately, realizing he's made a mistak

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Shit! Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun has started to set over the Gregg house. It will dark soon. Julie's car pulls up in the driveway and parks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie moves around the side of the house. A dead racoon carcass hangs, tied upside, from a nearby tree. Julie moves to the back door. She KNOCKS on it. Waits. No answer. ~

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Missy? Missy, are you home? Julie is determined. She wastes no time. She tries the door. It's locked. She moves toward the screen kitchen door. Looks through into the kitchen not seeing the FIGUR that appears from around the side of the house. Julie turns just in time to see a knife coming at her. Sh drops dowm, just missing it. It's Missy. Knife in hand. Ready to strike again. Her fac a mass of fear. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Please. Missy. It's me. Remember...car trouble...the other day.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Please, I need to talk to you. Missy lowers the knife cautiously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parade takes a turn onto another street where a whole crowd of SPECTATORS awaits. Helen loses sight of the Fisherman and Barry. She continues to wave, going through the motions, very frightened when suddenly she sees the.. Fisherman, standing up ahead, in the crowd. She does a double-take but then on the other side of the street she the Fisherman...wait a minute...but then she sees another The float passes by the Fisherman, he removes the hood fr his head...his face, young and sweet...he picks e CHILD u and places him on his shoulders for a better view. Father and son. Helen turns to the other Fisherman, his face is also in view...an older man, graying. She looks up and down the street, local Fisherman are everywhere. This calms her a bit, realizing this is a normal sight in fishing town. She takes a deep calming breath and exhales but then sees... ANOTHER FISHERMAN. This one stands alone with the hood over his head. He sta right on the street's edge...as close as you can get to t floats. She passes by him, waving, smiling. He pulls his hand from his coat pocket to reveal a large, shiny curved object. Helen looks at it closely. It's a fish hook. Sharp and deadly. It disappears back in his coat pocket. A very deliberate move. He was showing it to her. Flaunting it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The float breezes right by him, Helen sits rigid in her s scared to move. She scans the crowd for Barry...sees him (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: coming around the corner. Helen looks back to the Fisherm but... HE'S GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small river runs down the back of the house. Next to it sits an old.shed overflowing with furniture, boxes and ot stored items. Missy is busy at work, skinning a raccoon. She is fast an focused with the knife in her hend. Julie sits across from her, on a box, the open yearbook i her lap.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I need to find your brother's friend, Billy Blue. I need to talk to him. I was hoping you could look through this book...

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: Why? What's all this about? Missy is very suspicious. Julie is at a loss. She doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It's too crazy to explain but it has to do with your brother and last July 4th.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: What about it? Julie is unraveling. How much should she tell? She debate a second. Then, ah fuck it...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What happened to your brother wasn't an accident. There's more to it than that. Missy looks at her, simply.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: I know, Julie is dumbfounded.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You know what? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: He killed himself. This catches Julie completely off guard.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: He...what?

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: David wanted to die. He went up there to die that night. It's where Susie died. Everybody blamed him for Susie's death. He blamed himself. This throws Julie. She's disbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: But how do you know it was a suicide?

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: He left a suicide note... Missy moves toward the shed to an old wooden box. She opens it, sifts through it, withdrawing a crumpled piece of pap

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: I had to keep it hidden. His insurance policy wouldn't pay if it was a suicide. Don't guess it matters anymore. The money's been spent. She hands the letter to Julie. CLOSE ON the letter. Scrawled in very familiar writing are the words...

dialogues.speaker: I WILL NEVER FORGET LAST SUMMER
dialogues.text: Julie inspects the letter carefully. She has seen this handwriting before.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: This isn't a suicide note.. This is a death threat.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Julie begins to piece it together.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Your brother didn't kill himself, Missy. I was there. I saw him. And whoever sent this letter was there too. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MISSY .
dialogues.text: (pure surprise) You saw David? Where? Julie is nearly certifiable.

dialogues.speaker: . JULIE
dialogues.text: He was crossing the road...we hit him... it was an accident.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: But my brother drowned.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It was him, Missy. He had Susie tatooed on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? My brother didn't have a tatoo. ‘JULIE I saw it. On his right forearm. Julie is frantic, She's frightening Missy.

dialogues.speaker: MISSY
dialogues.text: My brother never had a tatoo. Look, I think you better leave. A realization overcomes Julie.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to herself) But...oh my God...it wasn't your brother. In a flash, Julie turns and races off, leaving Missy's he swimming in confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The town is hopping with the excitement of the festival. same scene as last year...music PLAYING, PEOPLE dancing i the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hall is packed with people. On stage are this year's collection of Croaker Queen wannabe's.  93 94 88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen stands backstage with her tiara and scepter in tow. Barry stands next to her, comforting her. She awaits her cue, edgy as ever.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Stay calm. I'll be up in the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: He had a hook, Barry, I saw it. This big huge hook. Barry puts his arms around her, pulling her against him. BARRY , . Everything's gonna be alright. I won't let anything happen to you. A ruby faced PAGEANT OFFICIAL approaches.

dialogues.speaker: PAGEANT OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Places please.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: I promise you. It'll all be alright. She tries to smile.

dialogues.speaker: BARRY
dialogues.text: Break a leg. Then he leans over and gives her a little kiss. Sweet and simple. Her face lights up...surprised...distracted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same MC as last year. The big seashell throne from th float sits center stage...contestants on each side.

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: And now let's meet last year' Ss winner. Miss Helen Shivers! The crowd applauds as Helen appears--tense and edgy. She walks center stage, takes a polite bow and moves to her throne. CLOSE ON her face. She looks up to the balcony.

dialogues.speaker: BALCONY
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Barry appears. He waves down et her, smiling. Sne smiles back, comforted...excited by his presence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie punches the gas, speeding down the road, frantic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaper's Curve approaches. She barely slows. She flies around it, unflinching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen sits in her shell watching the talent portion of th evening. A CONTESTANT, a young girl with long legs and to much lipstick moves about the stage in nothing but a biki and a beret atop her head.

dialogues.speaker: CONTESTANT
dialogues.text: (singing) . “Who can turn the world on with her smile. Who can take a nothing day..." CLOSE ON Helen who watches intently, disturbed. This girl some retro way reminds her of herself.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Jesus... Helen looks out into the crowd. She scans the audience looking for HIM. No sign. She glances up to Barry who watches the contestant sing her heart out. Helen smiles, looks so handsome up there all by himself.

dialogues.speaker: CONTESTANT
dialogues.text: "..it's you girl and you should know it. With each glance and every little movement you show it..." Barry's eyes find hers. He rolls his eyes at the contesta Helen smiles. Then Barry winks at her just as the... FISHERMAN APPEARS... standing directly behind Barry. Helen freezes in horror while the Fisherman withdraws a shiny instrument...curved rounded--the fishhook, It rises high behind Barry...a suspended instant...Helen SCREAMS... Barry looks to her, confused, as the hook strikes dowm wi force, imbedding itself in his back. Barry's body jerks (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: forward as the hook impales him...his eyes go wide and hi face tightens... Helen jumps to her feet, SCREAMING MADLY...the audience doesn't know what to make of it. The contestant looks annoyed...Helen jumps down from her throne and races acro the stage...

dialogues.speaker: MY GOD
dialogues.text: She points to the balcony but Barry's body has fallen fro view...the Fisherman upon him. Helen's the only one who s him. Everyone else is looking at Helen. She runs to the foot of the stage end leaps off it. Some members of the audience jump up and run to her. She CRIES AND SCREECHES hysterically. Suddenly a POLICE OFFICER appears, an earnest man in his early thirties.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Ma'am, ma'am...please.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Help him. He's killing him.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Who? Who's killing who?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: The balcony... The police officer looks at her in disbelief but acts accordingly. He turns to the confused and curious crowd.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Everyone stay calm... The officer takes off for the balcony. Helen follows righ behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The balcony is dark and cluttered. The police officer, al with Helen, and a PAGEANT OFFICIAL climb the stairs. The officer is moving too slow for Helen. She races by him... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: 10 x She's a blubbering mess. She runs to the railing...there' no Barry. He's completely disappeared. She turns to the police officer.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: He was here.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Who ma'am?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: The fisherman. He killed Barry.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Barry who? The officer is quickly becoming a skeptic. Helen searches the entire balcony. There's no sign of Barry or the Fisherman. The officer SIGHS with rolling eyes. - He's feeling like the brunt of a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MC stands on stage in front of a restless audience.

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: It was a false alarm ladies and gentleman. We'll resume the pageant in just a few minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's car races into the driveway. Julie jumps from it rushes to the front door, disappearing inside the house.

dialogues.speaker: INT, BACKSTAGE
dialogues.text: Helen is surrounded by PEOPLE. Someone hands her a cup of water. She's frightened beyond belief, barely able to spe Her bottle of pills fall from her pocket, spilling out on the floor. Everyone shifts nervously. The pageant offical appears.

dialogues.speaker: PAGEANT OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: (whisper) I just spoke with her parents--they said she's been disturbed lately... The officer gets it immediately. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (to Helen) Ma'am, I'm gonna take you home. Your . Parents are awfully worried about you.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Please...you have to believe me. ‘ Helen has lost it. She doesn't know what else to say. A the officer guides her out... The MC stops her...

dialogues.speaker: MC
dialogues.text: Excuse me, we'll be needing this... He lifts the tiara off Helen's head but fails to take the scepter that she clutches tight against her body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's at her computer typing feverishly.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Hurry! Hurry!

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: The words “SEARCHING" "SEARCHING" flash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The police car makes its way down a street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officer keeps an eye on Helen through his rearview mirror, A caged metal screen separates them.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: ..and then he killed him with a fish hook?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: And did the fisherman use this same hook to cut off all your hair?

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: No, he used scissors, asshole. Look, I know ZI sound delusional but it's true. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: I've heard this story. Only he wasn't a fisherman, he was en escaped mental patient who had a hook fora hand. The police car comes upon a roped off street. The annual street dance is in progress. The officer whips the car in reverse.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Ne'll have to take the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the computer screen es-all the David Gregg artic appear. Julie opens a file and scans the article aloud. Just like before.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Susie Tilly...killed...trapped in car...driver unharmed...survived by her father Benjamin...

dialogues.speaker: ON JULIE
dialogues.text: Her eyes wide in horror as she reads...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: A local fisherman.

dialogues.speaker: ON SCREEN
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the word FISHERMAN. In a flash, Julie is up and at the door. She rips it open barreling into a FIGURE. She SCREAMS. -It's her mother.

dialogues.speaker: MRS. JAMES
dialogues.text: Where have you been?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I don't have time, mom. Julie flies by her, moving down the stairs and out the do

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tne police car moves down a small alley way...dark and deserted. The street dance can be heard in the distance.  106 94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen has grown frantic. She's had it with the police. officer's patronizing attitude. She clutches the grill th separates them.

dialogues.speaker: HELEN
dialogues.text: Look, you little shit stick Mayberry~ass reject, there's been a murder and you're gonna fry in hell if you ignore it. Her intensity frightens him. He shrugs it off, coming to stop at the street corner. He reaches for his radio. OFFICER . I'll tell you what I'll do. I'll contact Barry's parents, we'll put -a search out for him. He was probably just playing a prank on you. Helen sits back in her seat, exasperated. She SIGHS, look out the front windshield. Ahead of them, sitting in the alley is a pick-up truck. T hood is up and a FIGURE leans down, inspecting the engine

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: Aw...Jesus... The officer pulls up behind it, stopping.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: I'll be just a minute, Looks like this fellow needs help. The officer gets out of the car and walks over to the tru

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: What's the trouble? Suddenly, the figure moves from under the hood, standing upright. IT'S THE FISHERMAN. CLOSE ON Helen who SCREAMS bloody murder.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The officer hears Helen's screams, turns back to the squa car as a fish hook rises behind him. Helen goes crazy, clawing at the metal screen, SCREAMING VIOLENTLY.

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND YOU
dialogues.text: The officer turns just as the Fisherman is on him, grabbi him by the throat...the officer reaches for his gun, but too slow. The Fisherman pushes him down against the expos engine and in one expert move slashes down with the hook impaling the officer.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK SEAT
dialogues.text: Helen goes mad clawing at the doors trying to get out, bu they don't open from the inside. She's trapped.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: The officer slowly sinks to the ground as the Fisherman's attention slowly turns to the police car.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK SEAT
dialogues.text: Helen goes ballistic, BASHING about like a caged animal.. tries to kick at the window with her feet.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD
dialogues.text: The Fisherman moves towards her. The fishhook dripping re

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK SEAT
dialogues.text: Helen KICKS and KICKS. The glass CRACKS. She looks up to see the FISHERMAN at the other door...too close. She rear back in a rush of mad energy and SHATTERS the glass. She leaps up..:with her scepter she clears the pane...the opposite door flies open. Helen lunges forward, crawling out the window, falling to ground. She brings herself to her feet and takes off down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helen races down the alley, burning it out. Feet POUNDING She SCREAMS WILDLY to no one. She turns, checks behind he The Fisherman walks towards her, calming, : swiftly...confident. She SCREAMS at the sight of him. She makes her way out of the alley and into.... oO ov enna “4 107°

dialogues.text: Tne night is young. The town continves to party. More and more people flock to the boardwalk, dancing and Juking it Julie moves down the boardwalk. She moves through the cro looking for Helen, Barry...anybody. She reaches the raili and leans against it, looking out onto the harbor.

She looks to Ray, jerking away from him, stumbling back onto the dock. A terrifying realizati creeps across her face.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Noooo. Julie pulls on it, realizes she's trapped. She turns quic and moves back down the dock looking zor help. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIE .

dialogues.text: Easy, child. This way. Julie's terrified, confused...

dialogues.text: Now that's a shame. Being 4th of July and all. Kids like you should be out having fun, drinking, partying, running people over, getting away with murder...things like that. Julie stops dead in her tracks.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: "COX SCORES TOUCHDOWN", Etc. The Fisherman has been doing his own research. He's been tracking their lives. Julie steps back in terrified awe.

Julie SCREAMS, reeling backwards, slipping on the icy surface...she grabs hold of a wooden slat for support but gives way...opening up a compartment of ice that comes CRASHING DOWN on top of her...she loses her balance, tumb to the floor. . Gallons and gallons of ice come pouring out of the bin, covering her. Julie shields herself, looking up to see th dead body of Barry, sliding down at her. Julie SCREAMS as Barry's body crashes down on top of her. Julie is face to face with Barry, sandwiched between her friends. She fights and struggles, CRYING OUT. She frees herself, sliding away from the bodies. She burs into HYSTERICS, curled on the cold floor, WAILING...beyon fright.

Ray is against the outrigger that juts up over the deck. grabs hold and climbs up and onto the cabin's roof. He watches as Tilly moves to the ice hatch.

dialogues.text: Tilly is at the hatch. He rips the lid off. 154 wee ae
ee

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: Julie...hurry. He reaches for her as she climbs the ladder. He helps her out and onto the deck just as...

dialogues.text: Jule SCREAMS...Ray spins around just as the back side of hook makes contact with Ray's head. Ray goes down, hurt. Tilly turns to Julie, grabbing her, throwing her against outrigger base. His face angered...crazed.

dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.text: as he pulls his pained body upright. He eyes Tilly as he readies to strike. He watches as the hook gets caught up the swinging lines that move across the deck. Ray eyes the winch. He lunges for the control _ handle...hitting it...sending the winch into motion. In a split second, the ropes SNAP up, flying up to the to the boom, pulling, yanking Ben Tilly with it. His whole h is jerked upward as he's carried to the boom. CLOSE ON Tilly's hand as it leads his body to the top of boom, heading right for the pulley and spinning rope. His hand gets twisted in the pulley with massive force. It ri skin...bone. Ben Tilly's hand is severed from his body. I falls to the deck...still clutching the hook. Tilly's body is not far behind...he grabbles, trying to g hold...his foot gets caught in the lines and he falls backwards...hanging upside down. His body swinging back a forth with the roll of the boat. The winch CRANKS AT CAPACITY. Ray joins Julie, grabbing h of her, hugging her just as Tilly's body swings towards t arm outstretched, They dodge him as... The boat rolls and Tilly swings to the other side of the boat, as if flying through the air. He comes at them agai Fast. Focused.

Tilly swings out over the side of the boat as the pulley gives way and his body goes crashing down into the deploy nets. His body gets tangled every which way in the nets es they disappear over the side of the boat into the cold, dark waters. Gone. Julie looks down to see Ben Tilly's severed hand, lying o the deck, still clutching the hook. She bends down, defia pumped...she picks it up by the hook, not looking, just slinging it overboard, as far és her strength will allow. It disappears into the night. Ray comes up behind her. She turns to him, grabbing him. They hold each for dear life. 160 wee ae  161 113. ra Or ay

dialogues.text: The fishing trawler is surrounded by coast guard boats, police speeders, etc. Lights have been hung, tase in plac it's now an official crime scene.

dialogues.text: Two YOUNG OFFICERS set'the winch, watching it spin cable, raising the nets from the water.

dialogues.text: stand together, watching, shivering in the cold night. Julie's face is a. world of disbelief. She tries to comprehend. JULIE . We never killed anyone. This last year was for... ” RAY I know. The guilt was killing me. That's why I went to see Missy. I had to know who he was...I'm sorry I didn't tell you about Missy. I wanted you back. I didn't want to lose you again. . She listens intently, looking deep into his eyes. Silent. RAY . I love you, Julie. No one gets me the way you do. A slight trace of a smile creeps across her face. A long moment .

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I understand your pain. Ray nods, they come together, holding each other tight. Suddenly, a FIGURE looms in front of them. It's the local sheriff. A round man with a serious face.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: (voice over) Do you have any idea why this man would want you dead? Julie looks at Ray. The moment of truth. Do they come clean? Will it help? A long stare and then, almost simultaneously. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: No...

dialogues.speaker: RAY
dialogues.text: None... They stare at the sheriff, their eyes. sincere, their fac genuine. Then they look to each other, knowingly. Their secret intact.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICER
dialogues.text: (voice over) Here it comes... They all turn to the side of the boat es the net makes it way out of the water. Wet and muddy. Torn and...empty.. THE FISHERMAN IS GONE. But wait...there's something. Small and shiny, clinging t the net. An officer shines a light upon...the fisherman's severed hand. It still clutches the hook, dangling in the net... Ray pulls Julie tight.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Her face a blank page. Emotionless. . The sheriff turns to Ray and Julie.

dialogues.speaker: SHERIFF
dialogues.text: Don't worry. The body will turn up...they usually do. Julie turns to the mouth of the harbor, her eyes locked o the ocean beyond. A long moment and then... FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's same dorm room. It appears less drab as if some interest has been paid to bringing it to life.

dialogues.speaker: ONE YEAR LATER
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Julie sits at her computer...a familiar scene. Only this time she types feverishly at the keypad. Her hands moving rapidly. The CAMERA comes upon her face and it appears a revelatio This is the Julie of old. Her youthful face has been restored. Vibrant and full of energy. She radiates from within. She's more than survived. She's transcended.

dialogues.speaker: MONITOR
dialogues.text: She's in the middle of chatting with someone on the inter She sends a message..."I MADE THE DEAN'S LIST." She waits for her reply. It comes, "FIGURES." She types a new message. "HOW'S NEW YORK?" A moment and then: “LONELY WITHOUT YOU." . Julie smiles, typing "GOTTA STUDY. I MISS YOU." A moment and then, “I LOVe YOU." CLOSE ON JULIE. The “love" word affects her. Suddenly, a FIGURE appears behind her, a hand on her shoulder...Julie spins around. It's her roommate, Deb. She holds an envelope in her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DEB
dialogues.text: You got a letter. Julie takes it. CLOSE ON the envelope, there's no postmar or return address. Julie's suddenly cautious. It's all to familiar. She hesitates a moment...but then rips it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Julie scans it, instantly relieved. It's just a flyer.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Another frat party. Knock yourself out. She tosses it to Deb who takes it graciously. Julie turns back to her computer just as the mailbox in the corner of screen begins to flash...dulie has an e-mail. She moves the cursor to the mailbox and CLICKS. A letter pops up...SENDER UNIDENTIFIED. Julie CLICKS it open and COMPLETELY FREAKS OUT. Her face turning a ghostly white a the life is sucked from it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On the screen is one simple sentence...a sentence that se Julie's world crumbling. On the screen are the words... I KNOW WHAT YOU DID LAST SUMMER... 162
